result.execSummary:
The defendant James D McAllister Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 11-29-2016:  CFTS = 0 days (Previous credit given on this count was duplicate to credit given on other sentences)
***AMENDED 12-4-2017: CFTS 457 DAYS.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 7 years 5 months bifurcated sentence.
***AMENDED 2/20/2018: To reflect Court ordered original sentencing as to Count 1 held on 9/9/2016 vacated as of 12/4/2017.***
Consecutive to: sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically parenting classes. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must pay child support. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentence currently being served

Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 7 yrs. 5 mos. years bifurcated sentence.

**AMENDED 5/31/2018: To reflect original sentence on 9/9/2016 is VACATED as of 12/4/2017.**
Consecutive to: revocation.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Pay child support.  Obey all rules and regulations.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Collections may include income assignment.

No controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically parenting classes. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must pay child support. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Atty Simonds
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant James D McAllister in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant James D McAllister in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
